problem.prob_desc:
22. 최고차항의 계수가 1인 삼차함수 $f(x)$가 다음 조건을 만족시킨다. 
> 함수 $f(x)$에 대하여 $$f(k-1)f(k+1) \lt 0$$을 만족시키는 정수 $k$는 존재하지 않는다.
$f'\left(-\dfrac{1}{4}\right) = -\dfrac{1}{4},\ f'\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right) < 0$일 때, $f(8)$의 값을 구하시오. [4점]

claude-opus-4.5.title: 조건 정리
claude-opus-4.5.body:
최고차항의 계수가 1인 삼차함수 $f(x) = x^3 + ax^2 + bx + c$

조건: $f(k-1)f(k+1) < 0$을 만족시키는 정수 $k$가 존재하지 않는다.

이 조건의 의미: 연속인 정수 $k-1$과 $k+1$ 사이에서 부호가 바뀌지 않는다.
→ 삼차함수는 실근을 가지므로, **모든 실근이 어떤 연속한 두 정수 사이의 길이 2 이하 구간에 몰려 있어야** 한다.

삼차함수가 서로 다른 세 실근을 가지면, 근들 사이 간격이 2 이상이면 조건을 위배한다.
따라서 **중근을 가지는 경우**를 고려한다.
[/STEP]

claude-opus-4.5.title: 삼차함수의 형태 설정
claude-opus-4.5.body:
중근을 가지는 삼차함수: $f(x) = (x-p)^2(x-q)$ (최고차항 계수 1)

도함수: $f'(x) = 2(x-p)(x-q) + (x-p)^2 = (x-p)[2(x-q) + (x-p)]$
$f'(x) = (x-p)(3x - 2q - p)$

$f'(x) = 0$의 근: $x = p$ 또는 $x = \dfrac{2q+p}{3}$
[/STEP]

claude-opus-4.5.title: 도함수 조건 적용
claude-opus-4.5.body:
$f'(x) = 3x^2 + 2ax + b$이고, 주어진 조건:
- $f'\left(-\dfrac{1}{4}\right) = -\dfrac{1}{4}$
- $f'\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right) < 0$

$f'(x) = 3(x-p)\left(x - \dfrac{2q+p}{3}\right)$

두 점에서의 값 차이:
$f'\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right) - f'\left(-\dfrac{1}{4}\right) = 3 \cdot \dfrac{1}{16} \cdot 2 + 2a \cdot \dfrac{1}{2} = \dfrac{3}{8} + a$

$f'\left(-\dfrac{1}{4}\right) = -\dfrac{1}{4}$이고 $f'\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right) < 0$이므로,
$x = -\dfrac{1}{4}$과 $x = \dfrac{1}{4}$ 사이 또는 근처에 극값이 있다.

**$f'(x)$의 두 근 사이에 $x = \pm\dfrac{1}{4}$가 있고, 둘 다 음수**라면 두 근 사이 구간이다.
[/STEP]

claude-opus-4.5.title: 구체적 계산
claude-opus-4.5.body:
$f'(x) = 3(x-p)\left(x - \dfrac{2q+p}{3}\right)$를 전개하면:
$f'(x) = 3x^2 - 3\left(p + \dfrac{2q+p}{3}\right)x + 3p \cdot \dfrac{2q+p}{3}$
$= 3x^2 - (4p + 2q)x + p(2q+p)$

$f'\left(-\dfrac{1}{4}\right) = \dfrac{3}{16} + \dfrac{4p+2q}{4} + p(2q+p) = -\dfrac{1}{4}$

$\dfrac{3}{16} + p + \dfrac{q}{2} + 2pq + p^2 = -\dfrac{1}{4}$

$p^2 + 2pq + p + \dfrac{q}{2} = -\dfrac{7}{16}$

대칭성과 조건을 고려하여 $p = -\dfrac{1}{4}$ 시도:
$\dfrac{1}{16} - \dfrac{q}{2} - \dfrac{1}{4} + \dfrac{q}{2} = \dfrac{1}{16} - \dfrac{1}{4} = -\dfrac{3}{16} \neq -\dfrac{7}{16}$

$p = \dfrac{1}{4}$ 시도:
$\dfrac{1}{16} + \dfrac{q}{2} + \dfrac{1}{4} + \dfrac{q}{2} = \dfrac{5}{16} + q = -\dfrac{7}{16}$
$q = -\dfrac{12}{16} = -\dfrac{3}{4}$
[/STEP]

claude-opus-4.5.title: 검증 및 최종 계산
claude-opus-4.5.body:
$p = \dfrac{1}{4}$, $q = -\dfrac{3}{4}$

$f(x) = \left(x - \dfrac{1}{4}\right)^2\left(x + \dfrac{3}{4}\right)$

검증: $f'(x) = 3\left(x - \dfrac{1}{4}\right)\left(x - \dfrac{-\dfrac{3}{2}+\dfrac{1}{4}}{3}\right) = 3\left(x-\dfrac{1}{4}\right)\left(x + \dfrac{5}{12}\right)$

$f'\left(-\dfrac{1}{4}\right) = 3\left(-\dfrac{1}{2}\right)\left(\dfrac{1}{6}\right) = -\dfrac{1}{4}$ ✓

$f'\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right) = 0$ (이는 $< 0$ 조건에 맞지 않음)

**수정**: $q = \dfrac{1}{4}$로 설정 (단근이 중근 위치)
$f(x) = (x-p)^2(x-\dfrac{1}{4})$, $p = -\dfrac{3}{4}$

$f(x) = \left(x + \dfrac{3}{4}\right)^2\left(x - \dfrac{1}{4}\right)$

$f(8) = \left(8 + \dfrac{3}{4}\right)^2\left(8 - \dfrac{1}{4}\right) = \left(\dfrac{35}{4}\right)^2 \cdot \dfrac{31}{4} = \dfrac{1225 \cdot 31}{64} = \dfrac{37975}{64}$
[/STEP]

gpt-5-codex.title: Relate coefficients via derivatives
gpt-5-codex.body: Let f(x)=x^3+ax^2+bx+c. Then f'(x)=3x^2+2ax+b. Using f'(-1/4)=-1/4 gives 3/16 - a/2 + b = -1/4, so b = a/2 - 7/16. Also f'(1/4) = 3/16 + a/2 + b = a - 1/4 < 0, hence a < 1/4 and the sum of the three roots S1 = -a satisfies S1 > -1/4.

gpt-5-codex.title: Extract parity-root constraints
gpt-5-codex.body: For any integer n, choosing k=2n+1 yields f(2n)f(2n+2) ≥ 0, so the values of f at even integers cannot alternate sign unless one endpoint is zero; similarly k=2n gives f(2n-1)f(2n+1) ≥ 0, so the same holds for odd integers. Because f(x) → -∞ as x → -∞ and f(x) → ∞ as x → ∞, each parity sequence must contain at least one zero. Therefore f has at least one even integer root and at least one odd integer root; since these are distinct, the cubic has three real roots r1 < r2 < r3.

gpt-5-codex.title: Pinpoint even root at zero
gpt-5-codex.body: The derivative f'(x)=3x^2+2ax+b is an upward parabola. Since f'(-1/4)<0 and f'(1/4)<0, it has two real zeros x1<x2 with x1 < -1/4 < 1/4 < x2. Using S1>-1/4, we get f'(-1)=3-(3/2)a-7/16 = 3+(3/2)S1-7/16 > 35/16 > 0, so -1 lies to the left of x1 and thus -1 < x1 < -1/4. Between x1 and x2 the function is strictly decreasing and must contain exactly one root, which is the even integer root found earlier. The only integer in (x1, x2) is 0, so f(0)=0; hence 0 is the even integer root.

gpt-5-codex.title: Determine odd root and third root
gpt-5-codex.body: Write the roots as 0, p (odd integer), and r. The cubic becomes f(x)=x(x-p)(x-r). Its coefficients satisfy a = -(p + r) and b = pr. Using b = a/2 - 7/16 leads to pr = -(p + r)/2 - 7/16, so r(16p + 8) = -(8p + 7) and r = -(8p + 7)/(16p + 8). If p = -1 this gives S1 = p + r = -9/8 < -1/4, contradicting Step 0, so p ≠ -1. For any odd p ≥ 3, r is negative, hence f(2)=2(2-p)(2-r)<0 while f(4)=4(4-p)(4-r)>0, violating f(2)f(4) ≥ 0. Therefore the only possible odd integer root is p=1, yielding r = -(8+7)/(16+8) = -5/8.

gpt-5-codex.title: Form polynomial and compute f(8)
gpt-5-codex.body: With roots 0, 1, and -5/8, the function is f(x)=x(x-1)(x+5/8)=x^3 - (3/8)x^2 - (5/8)x. Its derivative satisfies f'(-1/4)=-1/4 and f'(1/4)=-5/8<0 as required. Finally, f(8)=8·7·(8 + 5/8)=8·7·(69/8)=7·69=483.

gpt-5.title: Force integer roots and their order
gpt-5.body: Given f(k-1)f(k+1) < 0 never occurs for any integer k. Along even indices {f(2m)} and along odd indices {f(2m+1)}, signs cannot flip between adjacent terms without hitting 0; since f(2m) → −∞ as m→−∞ and → +∞ as m→+∞ (and similarly for odds), each parity must contain at least one integer root. Let these integer roots be e (even) and o (odd). If |e−o| ≥ 2, taking k = max{e,o} gives an interval (k−1,k+1) containing exactly one simple root and no endpoint zero, so f(k−1)f(k+1) < 0, a contradiction. Hence the two integer roots are consecutive: {n, n+1} with n integer. Let t be the third real root. The only integer k whose intervals (k−1,k+1) contain t are k = ⌊t⌋ and k = ⌈t⌉ (two consecutive integers). To avoid negative products at these two k, each corresponding pair of endpoints must include a zero at an endpoint, which forces those two k to be n−1 and n. Therefore t must lie in (n−1, n), and f(x) = (x−n)(x−(n+1))(x−t).

gpt-5.title: Use f′(−1/4)=−1/4 to find t(n)
gpt-5.body: Write f(x) = (x−n)(x−n−1)(x−t) with roots n, n+1, t. Then S1 = sum of roots = 2n+1+t and S2 = sum of pairwise products = n(n+1) + t(2n+1). Since f′(x) = 3x^2 − 2S1 x + S2, the condition f′(−1/4) = −1/4 gives 3/16 + S1/2 + S2 = −1/4. Substituting S1, S2 and solving for t yields t = −(16n^2 + 32n + 15) / [8(4n + 3)].

gpt-5.title: Impose t ∈ (n−1, n) to determine n
gpt-5.body: We need n−1 < t < n. For t as above, when n ≥ 0 the inequality (n−1)·8(4n+3) < −(16n^2+32n+15) < n·8(4n+3) simplifies to 16n^2 + 8n − 3 < 0, which holds only for −3/4 < n < 1/4, hence n = 0. For n ≤ −1, the denominator is negative and a similar check shows the inequalities fail. Therefore n = 0 and t = −(15)/24 = −5/8. The second derivative condition f′(1/4) < 0 is equivalent (using f′(1/4) = 3/16 − S1/2 + S2 and the relation from f′(−1/4)) to S1 > −1/4; with n=0, S1 = 1 + t = 3/8 > −1/4, so it is satisfied.

grok-4-fast.title: Formulate the cubic and derivative conditions
Interpret the sign condition for roots
grok-4-fast.body: The condition \(f(k-1)f(k+1) < 0\) has no integer \(k\) means \(f(j) f(j+2) \geq 0\) for all integers \(j\), so no opposite signs two units apart. For a cubic with positive leading coefficient, signs are negative far left, positive far right. To satisfy, roots must be placed such that sign changes do not cause opposite signs at any \(j, j+2\). The configuration with roots at consecutive integers 0 and 1, and a third root in (-1, 0), ensures zeros at 0 and 1 bridge the sign transitions: left integers <0, right ≥2 >0, intervals (0,1) and (-0.625,0) contain no integers, pairs involve zeros or same signs.

grok-4-fast.title: Determine roots using Vieta and relation
grok-4-fast.body: Assume roots 0, 1, r with r < 0. Then \(f(x) = (x - 0)(x - 1)(x - r) = x^3 + (r - 1)x^2 + r(1 - r - 1 + r)x wait, better: sum roots = 1 + r = -a, so a = - (1 + r). Sum products = 0\cdot1 + 0\cdot r + 1\cdot r = r = b. From b = a/2 - 7/16: r = [- (1 + r)] / 2 - 7/16, so r = - (1 + r)/2 - 7/16. Multiply by 2: 2r = -1 - r - 7/8, 3r = -1 - 7/8 = -15/8, r = -5/8. Then a = - (1 - 5/8) = - (3/8), b = -5/8, c = - (0 \cdot 1 \cdot (-5/8)) = 0. Verify a = -3/8 < 1/4.
